intro: Parochetus communis subsp. africanus, commonly known as the African parochetus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture.
